net.sf.JRecord.Types

Class TypeChar

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.JRecord.Types.TypeChar
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Type
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TypeBit, TypeCharNullTerminated, TypeCharPadded, TypeCharRestOfFixedRecord, TypeCharRestOfRecord, TypeNum

    public class TypeChar
extends java.lang.Object
implements Type
    Type Char

    This class is the interface between the raw data in the file and what is to be displayed on the screen for Character Strings

    Version:
    0.55
    Author:
    Bruce Martin

      • TypeChar

        public TypeChar(boolean leftJustified)

      • TypeChar

        public TypeChar(boolean leftJustified,
        boolean padByteOveride)
        Type Char

        This class is the interface between the raw data in the file and what is to be displayed on the screen for Character Strings.

        It also acts as the base class to other Text base Types

        Parameters:
        leftJustified - left justified option

      • TypeChar

        binaryField - wether this is a binary field

                                    java.lang.String val)
        Description copied from interface: Type
        Format a value for storing in the record, it has 3 uses
        1. Format the string for storing in a record.
        2. Format for storing as a String in a comma / tab delimited files.
        3. Validate a value
